comments.text: Lot of traffic, cars going slow there. You can stand directly next to the toll booths and there is shade, which is a big plus in summer. We were 2 guys and used Hungary sign
without sign, i had a ride directly to budapest in 10 minutes.
October 15; waited here with a BUDAPEST sign for 30 minutes. There were other cars offering a ride to Novi Sad within minutes which I rejected. Took the one going to the border.
for the other direction it was impossible to find someone going beyond Belgrade (in the evening with police around)
Quite some foreign cars - but still it took me 1 hour until somebody stopped - direct lift to Budapest, used a sign (BUDA)

We tried to hitchhike towards Nisz/Sofia, heading towards Istanbul. After a few conversations, we managed (with a good deal of luck) to catch a driver heading towards Nisz. The driver was so kind and positive that he took us to Nisz, even though he was going slightly in the opposite direction. What's more, he took us to a huge dinner at a good local restaurant. (We broke the speed record while hitchhiking, reaching 188 km/h.) Overall, it seems like a great place to hitchhike towards Sofia, with
Got a ride to Niš.
Great spot lot of traffic , we waited for 15mins with a Nis sign.
Petrolstation, direction South serbia (Nis) or Bulgaria, quite good spot to hit to the south. You can ask People, there is a lot of traffic, got a ride after 20 minutes to Nis.
Straight hitch to Belgrade airport, good spot!
Great place for hitch hike from čačak to Belgrade.
very good spot to Hitchhike from Cacak in the direction Belgrade. Lots of traffic and the cars aren't going to fast.

Great spot! Don't accept any ride anywhere less than the toll-booth right before turning to Subotica! I accepted one  to Vrbas due to miss communication( idk serbian and the guy didn't speak much english) had to hitchhike in vrbas toll-booth, which there was almost no traffic back to the highway. Luckily the third car passing by was going to Subotica and gave me a ride to the toll-booth right before

Used this spot a lot of times to get out from NS. My goal was to reach Subotica. Sometimes I caught rides within 5 minutes, sometimes had to wait for more than hour. Indeed, if you want to travel at least to Subotica, don't accept rides to Zmajevo, Vrbas and Bačka Topola.

Its good spot if u go north in direction of Subotica and the border. If u go to the border I recommend to be picky and accept rides at least to Subotica. Lots of drivers were proposing rides to Vrbas or Backa Topola. We got a ride to toll-booth south from Subotica.

It is hard to reach this place but it was worth it. The cars and trucks are driving slow because they have to stop to pay toll for the road. I had a sign for Subotica and found a truck in 15 minutes that brought me to the border with Hungary.
Perfect spot to go north
The spot to hh to Negotin. The road towards Negotin locals also call "Autoput" (highway in Serbian), even though it is not.
We just crossed the borders by foot and did not even start to hitchhike and some guy asked us if we want to go to Vranje. So we went there

It's pretty much easy to find car towards Beograd or Nis. All the cars passing in of you and you can ask directly to drivers. Me and my mate found direct car to Nis, Other two friends found directly to Beograd.
I couldn't believe anyone would stop... It was dark already... But in 15 minutes I got a ride to BIH!
Just stand next to the road and hh in preferred direction: north to Tara mountain, west to Bosnia, east to Uzice. There is monument of the train there, easy to recognize.
good long distance
Good spot towards Valjevo just few meters after roundabout
I was offered a ride to Belgrade from here without even asking
Very good spot after the frontier. To go in Serbia, good space to stop for the cars, and they see you from far away.
Oh how I love hitchhinking in villages, first car stopped
there are almost zero cars but every car will stop for you :D
Again we got a ride (couple) in almost zero time to Belgrade. There is no space for cars to stop, however cars go very slow and drivers do not mind to block traffic ;)
It’s easy to find a ride to Belgrade.

I asked drivers in the cue of the border.
Got a ride to Georgia
perfect
got a ride from a friendly truck driver within 5 minutes
Cars pass by very often. I waited maybe 10 minutes.
Going north to see Bor&Majdenpek. Instant pick up to a nearby town
Finally a hitch to niš

Good spot to hitch, I was going back to niš I took a hitch to pečenjevec. Which was probably a mistake timewise, but I ended up drinking with a Roma and a Serbian man in the small town so it paid off, dont take a hitch to one of the smaller towns west of the highway if you are tight on time and want to get to Niš

A guy drove me from Belgrade to IKEA, there is a nice gas station where you can hitch further south.

Its unlikely you'll end up here, but if you do its a great spot
Quick hitch to Banatski Karlovac on the way to Belgrade I got picked up pretty fast
We waited 1 minute, going to Romanian border
Got a hitch to Kikinda, 20 minute wait.
Hitchhiking with my friend Ana. Took us 11 minutes to get picked up, an amazing spot if you want to go further north of Belgrade
Got picked up very quickly, driver was going to Belgrade, but I wanted to stop in Čačak. You can get a direct hitch to Belgrade from here
I think any spot in this road is good enough, not many cars, but a lot of helpful people there. Easy to get ride to Višegrad

Literally third car stopped for me and took me to Kremna. In Kremna my driver left me on gas station and ask friend who worked there to help me catch a next car. Really nice and helpful people, in fact it wasn't necessary, I waited in the next place about 3min also.
La amikino, kiu veturigis min tuj kiam ŝi alvenis al ĉi tiu benzinstacio, trovis por mi iun, kiu iris rekte al Beogrado. Nur bonaj homoj. Sed tio estas signo, ke ili haltas tie.

Good spot by the poll station to get a ride to Sofia/Bulgaria. There were a few policemen doing controls but they weren’t interested in us and didn’t stop us. You can even reach this spot by foot (that’s what we did) from Dimitrovgrad by hitchhiking to a spot on the local road nearby and then there’s a path to the toll station. (check out the map) 
There was a fence around the station but it had big holes you could claim through and toll station employees and police didn’t mind.
Lots of space to stop for cars and they see you well. Got a ride to Novi Sad immediately.

We tried to hitchhike towards Nisz/Sofi. We didn't have time to part well when a very nice TIR driver stopped. He didn't go to Nisz, but he drove us to a large gas station from where it seems that we should easily catch something towards Sofia. In general, the place of great cars slow down is contact with drivers and entry on the A1 road.
Nice spot, enough space for drivers to stop.
First car stopped and took us to the Velika Plana, good spot
we got ride to much better place, the guy bought us drinks!
Stood right on the bus station. Were taken immediately by a nice Serbian guy. The people who didnt take us looked like they wanted to, but didnt have the space.

Great spot for hitching out of Belgrade north. There is quiet a lot of traffic, mostly local though. Easy to get a ride to a gas station or toll station on A1 northbound somewhere near Belgrade from which you can then hitch hike towards Novi Sad and Hungary. We were 2 guys, used Novi Sad sign and got a ride to Stara Pazova toll station.
Nice spot! Turkish guys took us to Belgrade, better then hitchhiking on the highway!
Very good spot, out of the city, busstop so good space for the cars to stop and shadow during the afternoon.
Got picked up instantly, with a sign saying Belegrad. Was lucky, but this is a great spot too
We came from Beograd by bus here, but cross border by walk you can not. So we ask drivers on border. They where kind.
good spot for rides to belgrad... we used a sign to signalise
All the cars passing this spot are going to Novi-Sad.
Most of the cars passing this spot are going in the direction to Novi-Sad so it is a very good spot to wait there.

I've asked for a piece of cardboard at Petrol station so I had a pretty large sign and stood at the very beginning of the turn to this petrol station with it. That's a good spot to go towards Belgrade/Novi-Sad I feel just being unlucky.
Was lucky to be picked up almost immediately by a driver going to Hajdukovo. Nevertheless a lot of cars pass this road on a free way to Subotica/border
A lot of cars pass there, convenient for you to stay, although no shade, as well as for cars to stop
Very good spot to get started towards BiH, got a ride very quickly and got dropped of in the middle of the flyover towards my destination.
Traffic going to both Bela Crkva and Vrsac. Truck stopped for me. Still common for locals to hitch between villages.

spot is around 100 meters after the last stop of the 3 and 9 bus. took us around 10/15 minutes to get a ride, good spot to go south, many cars going to belgrade. very easy for cars to stop, can recommend
Easy spot to get ride to Ruma. Good traffic and good place for stop

The best spot for the area. Waiting directly at the toll booth/ticket machine works better than in front. Works for hitchhiking north and south, so a sign makes sense.
On a Tuesday noon about 2-3 cars per minute passed.
To Ležimir
Hitchhike from here if you are going to the Stara Planina. Me and a friend got the ride to the waterfall Tupavica
Great spot for hitchhiking to Belgrade. Just after the roundabout, walk 150 meters and  you will see the big sign "Bon Voyage" written in Cyrillic, you can't miss it.
Easy to get the ride to Sremska Mitrovica, just ask truck drivers on the station, everyone go that direction
Hitchhiked many times from here to the highway. It is a bus stop and often you'll see other people hitchhiking as well. Sometimes waiting time is 2 minutes, sometimes 30-40 mins
HH spot to Pozega and Uzice. Lot of space and cars/trucks go slow here
I was hitchhiking here few years ago to Zrenjanin
Good spot, lot of place to stop, slow speeds and decent traffic. You can take busses from the center of Novi Sad to here or walk.

Tramprennen 2023 - This spot is strategically if you are going towards Bulgaria. It has shade as it is a bridge and if you are more than one person, one can hitchike on the normal road and another can have access to the highway (easily)
Good spot. Space to stop with the bus station or the gas station. I recommend
Really nice spot next to the bus stop.

A nice spot, there is space for the cars to stop. You can easily catch a ride in the direction of Prijepolje and even Montenegro. Would recommend having a sign.
A huge tip: don't hitchhike on this spot on Mondays as there is an open market happening that day and the parking lot is super crowded and busy.

A really nice spot to get a ride in the direction of Užice, Požega and even Belgrade. It is next to the stadium and there is place for the cars and trucks to stop. Never waited more than 10-15 minutes for someone to pick me up. I would also recommend to have a sign as it is super handy :)
The best spot to go east from cacak.

Big spot to pull over, loads of cars at a reasonable speed. A car stopped in 5 MIn but wasn't going to cacak, I declined and the next one 5 min later was going to ČAČAK. This spots catch all the cars from the ring roads going to cacak.
It's a toll. Perfect amount of cars on Wednesady afternoon (not too few, not too many), got a ride to Novi Sad

This place was recommended to me by a truck driver. Indeed, many cargo trucks go this way but I had an impression that this time (Wednesday afternoon) not many were going somewhere far from here. In the end I was brought only to the tall at the entrance to the highway
Low traffic from the Border but the 4th car (Truck driver) picked me up

Waited with a sign Nis, right on the highway just after the barriers (I saw two policemen looking guys hitch the same way). Hungarian driver going to Greece took me, Lots of traffic and no problem for car to stop directly on the road since the ones behind have to stop for the toll barrier anyway. Took bus 493 from Sava Centar in Beograd to get there, public transport is free (for now).
Waited there around five minutes to get a ride near Niš, you hve to walk all over the highway to get to the right side, but its doable.

It is probably the best spot to hitchhike over long distances. We got a lift to Bulgarian border after 80 minutes with a sign "Istanbul", if we waited longer and/or started earlier, it is probable that we get a lift all the way to Istanbul
A lot of space for hitchhiking just after the toll booth. Lot of trucks go to Bulgaria, I got the ride to Niš after 5-6 mins
Found a ride easily to Belgrade.
Got a ride from a swiss journalist right to the centre of Belgrade
I used to hitchhike here few times towards Belgrade or further south. Waiting time was always 20-30 min.

Got a ride to crossroads for Kramna/Zlatibor in like 3mins. I was just before entrance to the tunnel, on Google Streetview you can see a hitchhiker also. People are amazing and extremely helpful in this area.
I got a ride to Krema in the dark! I guess during daylight it would be even quicker...
Good spot. Space for both cars from Uzice and from the main road to stop. Got a ride to Kremna (30km west) after 10 mins. (From Kremna we got a ride to Visegrad after another 10 mins.)
30min with 3 people for a ride towards Sarajevo with sign "BiH". Might take much longer though, I feel we got lucky.
Direction Zlatibor/Mokra Gora/Bosnia. Just opposite the bus station, before the tunnel. The other marker is located in the wrong place.
I saved at the exit of the petrol station.
Standing just before the station, I got a ride in 5 minutes to another péage on the way to Belgrade
I got a ride to the highway ramp after about 20 minutes
Nowhere for traffic to pull into from the main road, but a decent spot if vehicles are filling up.  Pump attendant staff (Serge) very helpful in asking for rides for you.
Gasstation on the road to the highway (E-75) to Belgrade. Quite some traffic towards Zrenjanin, took a while (30 min) to get a direct ride to Belgrade.

Gazprom Petrol - Velika plana
Great spot. A lot of cars as well as trucks.
Good spot, found a ride to Bulgaria in seconds (he was going all the way to Burgas).
Excellent spot. Big gas and rest station. Mc Donalds as well. I hh without sign. Truck driver stopped.
HH at 8 AM in "Autokomanda". One of the best spots in Belgrade to go south along A1 highway. Got a lift to my destination (Paraćin) with a driver, who was going somewhere close to Macedonian border.
Autokomanda is a solid place to hitch out from Belgrade in direction of Nis. A ‘Rampa’ sign helps a lot.
Quite good place, much better then 2 crossroads west (at M1 road). Unfortunately transit goes around the city, so almost no trucks passing here :( Gypsy camp nearby ;)
Easy to get to if you arrive to the city center (there's a bus stop close by). Not a lot of traffic - locals + trucks. Got a ride almost to Dimitrovgrad quite quickly.
Usually a lot of cars,most of its going to Belgrad
A nice place, not so heavy movement (tuesday noon-afternoon), but rather easy to find someone going Belgrade or Novi Sad.
We waited maybe 25mins? Then some guy took us to Zlatibor. Good hitchhike spot, probably the best on the highway to Zlatibor/Montenegro

It's a highway and there's a whole unused line for cars to stop. Traffic is going surprisingly slow and drivers can easily see you. Got a ride to Montenegro direction in less than 10 minutes.

Technically hitchhiking on the highway is illegal, but come on, who cares about rules in Serbia?

That's why I love Balkans where you don't get 150 euros fine for doing something innocent and nobody will ever snitch on you.

I got to this station by Bus from Beograd(they're currently free due to protests in Serbia), but be careful because they're chaotic and Google maps doesn't show real bus schedule and routes. Better use Serbian app 'Moovit' to see actual information.

This spot was amazing! No many cars stop here, but for me it was a direct shot! After 5 minutes of asking drivers directly for a ride, I got picked up by a nice Serbian truck driver that went all way to Montenegro, which was extremely lucky!!!
The Petrol station is barely visible on the map, but it is spot with few trucks and cars going to Nisz, Cacak or Pozarevac.

After waiting more then an hour at the exit to Beograd (Belgrade) near Mega Roda, I decided to go by foot to that spot. One car stopped for me after 10 minutes but wasn't on my route, and ten minutes after another one stopped and gave me a lift to Beograd

I was probably hyper lucky. Can't tell more about that stop as the 1st car took me. The driver saw me from 200 meters and started to slow down and pull over from far. Took me all the way to Belgrade. It was during Christmas on the 5th of January

I tried the previews spots but nothing. You can get here with a bus. I hitches with sign RAMPA (toll). Nice guy stopped me and gave me a ride to the tolls. From there it was easier to get ride to Niš.
Nice spot! A friend and I used a Rampa sign, and ended up getting a ride to Nis. We made it to Skopje that day.
Tried it 20 Minutes without a sign. Then got curious with this "Rampa" sign. Did not work in the first place, but then a really friendly Serbian person stopped.
Best spot to get out of Belgrade: RAMPA worked with the second or third car that was passing (after trying the AVIA gas station for an hour).
use a RAMPA sign! this will help you a lot. as mentioned above, from the toll station you'll get away easily!

Had to walk across the border and got a strange look from the officer but it all went fine. After the border, I stood where all the lanes connect into one with a big sign and it took maybe 5 Minutes, till someone picked me up and took me all the way to Belgrad.
Got to the border with a truck driver and had to walk across due to big queues. On the other side hot a lift with another truck in about 30mins
Got a ride straight to Belgrade in 5 Min

esp/eng

llegamos a las 23h a la frontera. muchos vehículos pero no paran tuvimos que pagar para llegar a belgrado. frío
wearrived at 23 pm. many vehicles, nut no lifts. we had to pay to arrive belgrade. very cold weather
Guys!! Never accept a ride by a truck driver from Croatia, it will have to queue due to control! I Had to walk 5 kms and then people are not willing to accept you in front of policemens

Mi provis kaj benzinstacion kaj homojn venantajn de la ĉefstrato, neniu oficiala loko por halti, sed kiu scias. Knabino haltis apud mi kaj freneza fiulo venis tuj malantaŭ ŝi kaj daŭre kornis. Ne estas bona bushaltejo proksime, kiel oni menciis. Io ŝanĝiĝis.
The place is good but there is very little traffic towards the border. Many cars towards Pancevo, but that's just a few km away
we waited for one hour at the bus station just before it with a sign and nobody took us, at the petrol station we waited only 3 minutes
a gas station, towards Pančevo, Vršac and Romania. really good place. there is also a bus stop right before it.

somewhere over here there is apetrol station. you can get near it with those buses: 43,95,96, 101,104,105,106. you should go out of the bus in the first station after the bridge (the bridge that cross the river) than you should go up to the highway and after  about 500-800 meter you will get to the patrol station. its a good spot to get to pancevo, and from there to the east-north
Monday evening i waited like 3 hours for a ride to Belgrade. Therr was in general low traffic on the highway. Otherwise seems like a good place.
Good spot to ask people around. Mostly Germans/Austrians on vacation + Serbs (advantage if you speak German/any Slavic language). Gas station stuff is also fine. Got a ride to Belgorad quite quickly.
Barely any traffic , the spot is good though.
A lot of transit, found transport to Belgrad in 25 min
Good spot with a place for cars to stop
A lot of local people hitchhiking here (;
30 for drive to Zlatibor.
Perfect spot in direction to Zlatibor, Kokin Brod or Montenegro. Just under the bridge. You can pick up drives from Uzice, but also vehicles that don't pass through the city. Common place for locals.

It was my first time ever to try hitchhiking and I had a sign to Zagreb. After waiting for 15 minutes 2 other hitchhikers came to the exact same spot which was nice. After 50 minutes there was finally a car that stopped and instead of Zagreb I went to Novi Sad.
The first car we asked took us to the border with Croatia. I don't knwo id there is a way to come directly here, if not you can hitchhike from the previous gas station
Most of the cars are going towards Novi Sad. We waited for more than 2 hours, and after that one macedonian guy who was driving to Swiss, brought us straight to our hometown, Postojna, Slovenija.
a gas station. possible also to hitchhike on the highway. direction to  Croatia or Novi Sad.
Cars can easily stop on the parking lot. Although lot of people only travelling localy.
Many people want to take you a short distance. Recommend just bunny-hoping to Belgrade

We waited maybe half an hour, then a nice guy from France took us to nearest gas station from where we found a ride to čačak in 5 minutes. I would recommend to hitchhike from the gas station, its maybe 10km from here so just ask someone to take you there (its not on the highway but on some other road, but it worked for us)

The place is good for stopping with the bus station and everything, however we had no luck and were still in the same place after two hours. We wanted to go to Čačak, we think most people travelling in that direction go through Novi Belgrade, on the other side of the Sava.
After trying next to the bridge before, we decided to move here, and quickly got a car to Cacak, using a sign. They can easily stop at the bus stop.
Not too bad spot, with enough visibility and place for a car to stop after the off ramp. Got a ride to a petrol station 30km away and after the toll.

Very Good Place to Hike To the South of Serbia, also mazedonia and greece.
a local shoed me the place ist quite good
Not a really good place, low trafic but not many options here. Waited 30min and a truck took me further (solo male backpacker, sign "Beograd")
I was waiting at parking lot just after border check, and one older man came to me and asked whether i want to go to Germany :)

where the truck come out from the border.
direction: Belgrade.
Hitchhiking spot for Sofia, cars going really fast and not so many of them stop on the gas station. I got the ride after 1 hour and 15 min

An alternative hh place to hitch rides to the east (in direction to Bulgaria). Alternative as if you are somewhere in near, it might take you a long long time to get to the center of the city and catch local buses to Prosek village hh spot. Here, this is actually a parking lot and a petrol station. Access to this petrol station is through broken fence behind it, there are even some locals using this as shortcut to their properties from the other side of a motorway. Hitchhiking here is okay as th
We got a ride to gas station in Belgrade very quickly.
I hhed several times here, few times towards Belgrade but also few times towards Nis and I got rides easily by just asking people why they were taking highway-entrance-cards.
Pay-toll station close to Pozarevac is the very good place to get a ride either south (Nis etc.) or north (Belgrade etc.) as there are lots of traffic coming from Djerdap region.
Maybe I was just lucky but a guy with his mom picked me up very quickly with my sign RO. He did make me cross the border on my own, but then he took me all the way to Timișoara

Not a lot of traffic but enough. Was a typical mixture of Serbian and Romanian plates. Was surprised it took an hour and a half to get a ride. Good space to pull over and lots of shade in the morning.
Bit long but I guess that’s what you get when thumbing in Serbia, got a ride to Vršac after an hour

Kamioneto kun laboristoj el diversaj landoj irantaj al la vilaĝo Alibunar prenis min. Ili haltis iom post la bushaltejo, tuj post alia kamiono, kiu haltis je la sama momento, sed ne por mi. Ili atendis ĝis la malgranda kamiono malaperis. Ili donis al mi fruktojn kaj proponis pagi al mi trajnon al la sekva urbo antaŭ la limo. Mi rifuzis, ĉar tio estus tro multekosta.

Good spot, good visibility, helpful people on the gas station, only one disadvantage is little traffic. Anyway I get a car in 3min and actually they were going to Sarajevo, I wanted to get only to Mokra Gora at that moment.
Was left here after hitching from Uzice. Not too much traffic, but got a ride to Visegrad after not too long
Two guys. Lot of cars, doable.
1 PM. There is a little place to stop at the begining of a new road line. However, cars do not go that fast. With a sign of "Cacak" we (couple) got a ride in 20 min.
Mainly local traffic. We use sign "Cacak" to go further the town and we were dropped off at the end of Cacak.
After the roundabout. The cars are not fast, and there's space. I got a ride in 4 minutes to Uzice!
I got the ride to Belgrade after 20 minutes, but I hitchhiked before the toll booth
We were hitchhiking in the late evening in dark so there was only a few cars passing by. After a while we finally got a ride to some gas station on the way to Leskovac.

We walked on the highway for like 5 min until a trucker picked us up
(2 guys)
Took a bit of time but eventually you’ll find a ride going towards either Belgrade or Novi Sad.
North
Straight hitch to Belgrade, good spot with enough room for cars to stop

there was a spot with 6 local school children hitchhiking right after school closing, but me and my friend decided to walk an extra 1.5km down the road to a different spot to not take their rides.

Theres a perfect hitch spot 1.5km south of this spot at a bus station.

Mi alvenis ĉi tien malfrue nokte, do mi decidis dormi en la malgranda arbaro maldekstre de tiu, kiu venas de Bosnio al la rivero, proksime al la malnova ponto. Bela kaj trankvila loko por kampadi. ​​Kaj poste mi nur rajdos kelkajn minutojn post la kontrolo de la ekoparko.
Tiu ĉi mirinda persono iris al la poŝtoficejo kaj haltigis min, demandante kien mi iras. Ŝi petis min atendi 10 minutojn kaj ke ŝi kondukos min al Užice.

sufiĉe da spaco por halti, kaj ne tiel rapide, sed la frato haltis ĉe mi en la bushaltejo, kio eble estas pli bone, tamen kiam mi kontrolis, ke aŭto jam estis parkita tie, feliĉe ĝi malaperis, do ĉi tiu frato povus esti haltinta ĉe mi, sed mi devis rimarki ĝin de malproksime.
veturado per malnova jugoslava aŭtomodelo al la limo, ulo iris al la kamparo. Proksime de la enirejo de Moja Voda

Spot to hitchhike up to Babin Zub, the starting points of many hiking routes, including up to Midzor. Even in offside season, we got picked up quite fast. Not many cars, only other hiking tourists, but they are happy to give you a ride.
Spot to hitchhike back from Babin Zub to villages like Crni vrh or further down to the valley after hiking. Fellow hikers are very nice and pick you up to give you a ride down.

Spot to get up into Stara Planina mountains. (Crni vrh village, babin zub) Almost no traffic, but the locals are very nice and helping and you get picked up. 

You can just sit there and read a book or so, enjoy the fresh mountain air and every twenty minutes or so when a car comes thumbing.. :) Although this is my experience outside the tourist season. During skiing season or on summer weekends it might be more traffic.
Good spot at the toll to hitchhike out of Nis for both directions! Only disadvantage is that you have to walk a few kilometers to get here (see hitchwiki for directions!) and that there’s no shadow.

A lot of Serbians cars going after the work (16-17:00) back home. A lot of traffic. I believe this is a good spot (especially for Serbia, where they don't usually take hitchhikers). You don't even need a sign.
True that you won't get far though.

I was at this spot 2 or 3 times but never got a lift fast. Usually I was waiting for 40-60 minutes. Some rides took me just to the highway to Belgrade/Budapest but a lot of people travel all the way to Novi Sad and Belgrade
Good spot, after some time we got ride south, there is wierd lady living nearby so be careful :D
Not much place to stop. We got a ride to Uzice with a sign.
Not the best, but definitelly better then hitchhiking on the borders where we waited for 35 mins and no one stoped.
We waited 45 mins with sign “MNE” thaen a nice truck driver took us to Podgorica. Probably the best spot in Zlatibor.
No shadow, but good spot, there is a lot of car and they have the space to stop and they see us nicelly.
Good spot to go to Novi Sad. Shadow during the afternoon and good place for the cars to stop with a good visibility.
Very good spot, no shadow
2 persons. Started hitchhiking in the direction of Niš. After about 10 minutes, I got a ride to Autokomanda, which is a much better spot to hitch from.

Started hitchhiking at night right after crossing the Serbian border on feet. There's a huge queue of trucks there, don't use sign there, because just near the Montenegro border there will be another huge line of trucks. Use this place to just hitchhike a ride through 3km buffer zone with your thumb and cross next border by walk.

Border workers are helping you to get a ride

It was really slow on a saturday, but I think I just had bad luck. At first I tried to get to Sofia directly, after an hour I switched to Niš and hitched directly from the sidelane of the highway, which worked fine. There are a lot of trucks and enough cars, so I think in general its a good spot during work days, on the weekend there was mostly local traffic and trucks on a break though. Has a restaurant too.
Waited an hour, low traffic but it works in the end. Had a sign "Beograd" but a truck offered me to go to Sarajevo soooo new plans (solo male backpacker, sign "Beograd")

There is a parking near shop, convenient for drivers to stop. Although road doesn't really lead anywhere but border, had to wait for 1,5 hour. Anyway the spot is great if you are going from NS/Subotica by free road to small border.
